    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Everton and Leicester clashed in a thrilling Premier League fixture that ended with an Everton victory by a scoreline of 4-2. The match was packed with action from the very beginning, giving the fans exactly what they came for—a true spectacle of football.

The game kicked off with Leicester taking the first touch. However, almost immediately, the ball went out of play, showing that nerves and high tension were part of the atmosphere right from the onset. Everton quickly took the throw-in but Leicester managed to clear the situation momentarily. Determined to make a mark early on, Everton pushed forward aggressively and their persistence paid off. A crisp shot on target was all it took; an Everton player found the back of the net just 29 seconds into the game, sending the home fans into a state of euphoria.

Leicester restarted the game, trying to shake off the early setback, and just over a minute later, suffered their first foul, giving Everton a chance to create something from an indirect free-kick. Everton, maintaining the momentum, drove forward but the Leicester defense stood firm this time, clearing the ball out of danger.

Just minutes later, Leicester struck back. After forcing a clearance from Everton’s defense, Leicester created their first meaningful attack. They managed to place a well-timed shot on target in the 4th minute, just under four minutes from their initial setback, leveling the game 1-1 and making it clear that they were not going down without a fight.

Everton, undeterred, immediately resumed the game with another kick-off. The battle for dominance saw a series of throw-ins and balls going out of play, indicating that both teams were trying to establish control. Amidst this gritty midfield tussle, fouls were inevitable. Everton conceded a foul in the 8th minute, leading to a direct free-kick and a subsequent goal for Leicester which took place just before the 10-minute mark. Leicester's second goal brought an early twist to the game, putting them ahead at 2-1.

Refusing to let Leicester dominate, Everton kicked off once again, but the pattern of the game did not change as both teams exchanged control of the ball with numerous throw-ins and clearances. Everton fought through Leicester’s now-enhanced defense and managed to force a corner by the 12th minute. Though this did not result in a goal, Everton’s persistence was evident. 

The relentless back and forth continued, with Leicester carving out another opportunity in the 13th minute with a shot on target. Over the next several minutes, multiple throw-ins and clearances punctuated the play, showing the competitive spirit and the high intensity at which the game was played. However, the real highlight came when Everton equalized in the 22nd minute. A moment of brilliance saw another shot on target, which found the back of the net, leveling the score once again at 2-2.

With the drama far from over, Leicester didn't waste time. A combination of throw-ins and clearances dominated the next few minutes, with both teams trying to figure out how to break the deadlock effectively. By the 27th minute, tempers had started to fray, leading to a tension-filled moment with simultaneous bookings for players from both teams.

As the clock ticked towards the 30-minute mark, Everton reorganized and kept pushing. Their determination was rewarded just before half-time, when a goal from a well-coordinated attack effort found its way to the back of the net in the 40th minute. This goal allowed Everton to enter the break with a lead of 3-2, putting them in the driving seat for the second half.

The second half started with Everton kicking off the game, hoping to maintain or extend their lead. Early signs showed both teams were up for continuing their first-half intensity. However, less than a minute into the second half, a foul committed by Leicester presented Everton with another potential opportunity. While nothing came of this, the tone for the half was set.

Everton didn't let up and, just after nine minutes into the second half, had another throw-in. Leicester committed more fouls, presenting Everton with multiple free-kick opportunities, one of which turned out to be fruitful. In the 11th minute, Everton took a shot on target which hit its mark, giving them a commanding 4-2 lead.

Leicester made a couple of substitutions around the 15-minute mark of the second half, in hopes of changing their fortunes. However, Everton resolutely held their ground, disrupting Leicester’s ambitions at every turn. Another preparation ensued where the game saw several more throw-ins and exchanges of possession as Leicester tried to claw their way back into the match.

The Leicester side made another attempt in the 33rd minute, carving out a shot on target, but Everton’s defense was prepared and managed to neutralize the threat once again. Persistent fouls from both teams kept the referee busy as he handed out yellow cards and stopped play for set pieces.

The stout defense from Everton frustrated Leicester's players, and despite their efforts, they struggled to break down Everton’s tough line. Everton, on the other hand, managed to keep control over the game, although they also had their fair share of fouls and clearances.

As the game neared its conclusion, Leicester kept pushing, with a notable effort seen in the 42nd minute where they forced a corner. Yet, even this opportunity slipped through their grasp as Everton maintained their lead. The game ended with Everton smartly clearing their lines and managing the remaining time to ensure a deserved 4-2 victory over their visiting rivals.

In summary, this encounter at Goodison Park delivered an exciting match that had action and drama from the get-go. Everton's early blitz and consistent pressure eventually saw them clock a decisive win against Leicester. Each side displayed moments of brilliance, but it was Everton who took their chances better. The match was a wonderful display of Premier League football, filled with excitement, controversy, and four wonderful goals from the home side that secured their victory.
